intro: Parosela dentata, commonly known as the serrated parosela, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, serrated leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
